description: Logo for a competition entry.
pro: Balanced and clean.
cons: I don't like the sharp separators. Now I would also change the slogan's style.

description: I'm proud of this watch face. Functionality, history, and patriotism in one.
pro: I think nothing can be added or removed from it.
cons: No remarks.

description: Belt projectile dispenser. Idea, design, production, and testing took me about a month to complete all stages.
pro: Elegantly solves a specific problem.
cons: I use PLA, which is not very heat-resistant. I already have an idea for improvement, but I don't know when I'll be able to realize it.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I don't think there's much to say about it.
pro: The stylized first letter can be used alone as an app icon.
cons: I could have put in more effort.

description: I had some extra blue, I like King, and thought, let's do it!
pro: I found a solution to the balance problem with the letters. They're stable and don't fall easily.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo for a competition entry. One of my older designs.
pro: Looks super stylish. I like my idea of merging the two letters this way.
cons: No remarks.

description: The game X and O. It even has a lid, I'd say it turned out well.
pro: Looks great, color and execution.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Sometimes I just opened Corel for 3 minutes, just to take a break.
pro: None.
cons: Looks bad and unfinished.

description: Bookends, based on a client's idea. Themed for the Holly Black series.
pro: They look great.
cons: They're light and not very stable.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I like this logo.
pro: I like the minimalist style and how I managed to create something good-looking with just 5 geometric shapes.
cons: Should the slogan be on the right? I don't know, I'm not sure.

description: Refurbishing an old sewing machine. Tracing and printing on foil.
pro: Looks identical to the original.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo and cover for my brother's Facebook page.
pro: I'd say it does the job and is instantly recognizable.
cons: Could have been better, I did it a bit hastily.

description: Logo for a competition entry.
pro: I only like the color combination.
cons: I don't think it's my best work. It's unfinished and doesn't look good.

description: Logo for a competition entry. A bit outside my style, color gradients don't belong in a logo, but I allowed it here because it's for print services.
pro: I like this logo!
cons: Now I'd choose a different font combination.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Maybe not what the client was looking for, but I think it's very good.
pro: I like the arrow on the left. I think it's memorable.
cons: No remarks.

description: Watch face design for a Fiverr client. No idea what it's for, but it's very interesting. Lots of clarifications about the stones and their placement.
pro: Super stylish! Finished and very detailed. I love this design!
cons: No remarks.

description: Another watch face, for a retro clock. Nothing more to say.
pro: Very close to the original.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo that won a competition. The client was happy, so was I!
pro: Good color combination. Clearly expressed movement, just as the client wanted.
cons: No remarks, actually I have some small ones... but I don't want to criticize it because I like it.

description: Nameplate for a front door. Laser cut, UV print.
pro: Beautiful, well-designed final product.
cons: The UV printer didn't produce the green I expected at all.

description: The design speaks for itself. Overall not bad, but nothing unique.
pro: The sign became informative and clear. The design works.
cons: Now I'd choose a different car image... actually, the whole design would change...

description: Logo for a competition entry. I have mixed feelings about it.
pro: I like the cut in the first letter, I used the piece from it in the dot of the letter 'i'.
cons: Will that dot before 'COM' even be visible? I also don't like the letter 'P'.

description: Logo that won a competition. One of my first logos. The client didn't understand the connection between the two letters. He asked if I added the dumbbell to show strength? Actually, it's a graphic element representing connection.
pro: Minimalist and memorable.
cons: Dumbbell or connection? It wasn't clear.

description: Logo that won a competition. Just look how cheerful it is, I remember having a lot of fun making it! Also one of my first, probably from 14 years ago, I think I used Inkscape at the time... I know, Inkscape doesn't have CMYK, but let's not talk about that now.
pro: Very positive.
cons: I wouldn't exactly call it a logo.

description: Logo for a sports club in Vidin. I'm extremely happy when I see young people winning medals wearing a t-shirt with my logo.
pro: I'm proud to have created something that inspires young people, completely free!
cons: It could be a bit tighter, I can't explain it, I think it needs a slight redesign.

description: Refreshing a boring wall clock with a modern video game motif.
pro: From a boring original to something fresh and interesting for young people.
cons: I cut the dial a bit roughly.

description: Collage. That's us, framed.
pro: Nothing to say about this.
cons: I didn't anticipate the frame would cover part of the collage, the text is a bit lower than desired.

description: 3D printed keychain, laser-cut plexiglass, and photo paper print.
pro: They're light and look good.
cons: Overall, a waste of time.

description: Bookends with a quote in Bulgarian.
pro: They look great.
cons: They're light and not very stable.

description: The client was satisfied and uses it actively.
pro: It does the job.
cons: There's an idea, but it could have been better.

description: This was for a Fiverr GIG.
pro: The sample business cards look good.
cons: I don't particularly like the main text.

description: The young lady got her branding and was happy.
pro: I like the dark tone and how the gold looks on it.
cons: Overall, it could have been better.

description: 7 participations, 4 wins, and 6 podiums, if I can trust chatGPT. Full wrap design.
pro: Turned out pretty well, I'd say.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Nothing special.
pro: Will look good even on a pen.
cons: Font with sharp corners and icon with rounded corners is not the best combination.

description: Did you know that on retro clocks, the Roman numeral 4 is often written as IIII? I don't know why, but that's how it is.
pro: Excellent watch face.
cons: No remarks.

description: Again, aiming for an authentic look.
pro: Nothing to add here.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Who knows when this was made... it's terrible.
pro: Can't think of anything positive when I look at this.
cons: The separators, the cow... everything is terrible. I don't know what I was thinking when I made this.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Do you know what designer's blindness is? It's when you don't see the mistakes in your design until you look at it again later. I remember thinking it was great while making it, but now I can't believe what I did.
pro: At least it's uniform, would print and cut without issues.
cons: The person writes cookbooks, but the logo doesn't really say that.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Around here I started developing my own style.
pro: I like the space between the frame and the letters.
cons: Looks a bit unfinished.

description: The client makes clocks that run backwards!!! Who buys these things?
pro: I like the idea of reverse movement incorporated into the letter O.
cons: Isn't the font a bit too thin? I don't know, I'm not sure.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Medical theme, health care or something like that... It was a long time ago.
pro: If I had chosen a proper font, I'd give myself 5 stars.
cons: Did I really choose this font... what is it anyway - Helvetica?

description: Logo for a competition entry. There was a trend with this braid. Generic logo overall, but eye-catching.
pro: All the letters are uppercase, but some are more uppercase than others :)
cons: No remarks.

description: I won't comment on this logo.
pro: Nothing to add here.
cons: I have remarks, but I don't feel like criticizing.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I'm glad the client didn't choose it, because I don't like it.
pro: I like the text but not the icon.
cons: Something is wrong with this logo.

description: A chocolate egg and a card for the ladies at work. Made a nice little gift for March 8th, the girls loved it.
pro: Font Lobster - forever.
cons: No remarks.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Not sure, I think the people traded in specialized scrap collection machines.
pro: Nothing to add here.
cons: I got the idea, but didn't develop it adequately.

description: Logo for a competition entry.
pro: Visually pleasing with these two shades of purple.
cons: Small details won't be visible on a business card.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I think it looks good.
pro: Hints at construction.
cons: There's still room for improvement.

description: Logo for a competition entry. No idea how old it is. I don't know why I added the butterfly, maybe it was a client requirement.
pro: Nothing to add here.
cons: The serif font doesn't match the logo's style.

description: Logo for a competition entry. Another example of designer's blindness. I thought it was a masterpiece while making it, but now I see I was wrong.
pro: Reminds me of a green shopping bag, which was my goal.
cons: The sharp cut in the leaves, incredibly ugly execution.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I don't think it's my best work.
pro: I like the white background and nothing else here!
cons: It's as if someone pulled my canvas while I was drawing, it's unfinished.

description: Logo for a competition entry. I'll give myself 5 stars here, part of the brief was to think outside the box, abstract and different.
pro: I just like it, that's all!
cons: Overlapping elements, hard to print and cut.

description: Very, very old. If anyone asks, I didn't make it! I think I was just learning to work with vector graphics.
pro: Makes me a bit nostalgic, it was a long time ago.
cons: Huge elements, tiny details, no idea.
